page.title: 19The Victoria Hall.
page.content: The main hall was built in l897 to commemorate the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Victoria. Two small halls were added in 1906. An annexe was added 5 years ago and houses the Citizens Advice Bureau and the registrar of Births, Deaths and Marriages. The hall is fully used by the local community and is important to the life of the village. It is used by a variety of clubs from Dog Training to a Model Yacht club. Sports clubs from Badminton to Table Tennis use the hall.The back hall is used to accomodate volunteers working on the canal. English classes are held for Belgian students in the main hall. The Ash Playmakers use the hall for their rehearsals and also for putting on productions especially a pantomime at Christmas time.
